content: hey guys philip out back for episode 6 of black magic crafts today
we're going to be making these really cool-looking gothic archways close up
excellent for castles crypts highly decorated caverns they got that kind of
Hirst arts molded look with one big difference they're made out a dollar
store foam core and they're very easy and very fast to make and I'm going to
show you how you can pump out a whole bunch of them that all look exactly the
same so let's go over to the work desk and
make one up first thing you'll need to do is make some double thickness foam
core board for those of you who don't know you want to get the stuff at the
dollar store not the stuff at the hobby store because as you can see you can
easily peel off the paper peel it off from both sides and take a glue stick
and glue both surfaces together you can make this any size you want I'm making
it small for demo but you could make a large sheet of this if you're going to
make a whole bunch of these doors at once
okay once you got the glue on both sides just push them together and try to put
as much pressure on as possible here I use a thick metal ruler to give a even
pressure across the whole thing and squeeze out any air gaps then grab your
template what you know of template I got you covered I really didn't want to try
to explain all the geometry of the archways that I made and measurements I
just want to make it super easy so I whipped up these templates that you can
print out and I'm going to show you how you can use them and save them and make
a whole bunch of doors just from this so if you want to get it there's a PDF just
go into the video description and you'll find a link there okay let's get back to
it so once you've printed off your template
just cut off all the excess grab some heavy chipboard or the heaviest
cardstock that you have on hand the firmer the better grab a glue stick and
coat the back of your paper and glue it to the chipboard again use something
heavy and flat to squeeze out all the air bubbles and make sure you get a good
bond then you can go ahead and start cutting out the two different pieces I
find it as useful to use a straight edge on this as you going to be using this
multiple times you want it to be as straight as possible
when we get to the top I ditch the straightedge just because I find it a
little bit easier to control your cuts without it on these small ones there
that's one piece done you're going to repeat this process on the other one but
on the second one you're actually going to cut out the inside then just make
sure the two templates line up with each other nicely then lay your template on
top of your foam core and cut out the perimeter here I just lined it up to the
two edges because I squared off that corner of the foam core first once you
have that cut out take your second template and cut out the inside you
might want to switch to a smaller exacto knife for the top two cuts just so that
you don't tear anything out and take your time with this one cut through a
few times from both sides now we're going to add some
embellishments I just take a ballpoint pen and trace out a highlight line
around the edges you can do whatever pattern you'd like but the one I used is
shown on the template if you want to follow that and if you've never used
this technique before all you have to do is press in with a bit of pressure and
it will give a nice groove that will show up when you dry brush it then we're
going to add some stone texture I just take a wad of tinfoil rolled up like a
rolling pin go across all the surfaces and once you're happy with your texture
you can put it on a base I just use the thick popsicle sticks or tongue
depressors and I cut one edge off square and then mark out the width of the door
until you have one that's the same size and then place the door centered on the
base and make some reference lines so I know exactly where to draw up it when I
glue it take some hot glue make a couple dabs and just push the door in firmly
make sure that it's standing at a good 90 degree angle from the base next we
want to completely coat the foam with some 50/50 water and PVA glue this will
just give it a lot more strength because the foam itself cut like this is fairly
flimsy I go through make sure every surface is covered especially if you're
going to want to spray-paint these you want to make sure there's no missing
spots then I take a bit of full strength PVA glue put it on the base and drop
some construction sand on this gives it a bit of texture but it also gives a bit
of weight to the base so that the door wants to stand up instead of falling
over then once that's dry you can coat
everything in black because you coated it with PVA glue you actually can spray
paint these then just go ahead and cover the entire thing in a dark grey once
that's all dry you can go with some lighter gray and just do some highlights
with some dry brushing the lighter the better you can always put on more but
it's hard to take it off at this point and you can see at this point all that
stone texturing you did with the tin foil start to show up you may find that
those accent lines that you penned on to the foam have kind of disappeared so at
this point I usually take some really watered-down black paint and a very fine
brush and just go over all those lines to make them pop out again and you want
to do this with a really watered down black it'll let the paint flow into
those crevices and as it dries it'll lighten up and it won't look so stark
it'll look a little bit more natural and at this point you're done all right
that's it that's one doorway down now just to make a whole bunch more I hope
you guys found this video helpful and even more so I hope you found that
template to be useful if you did please let me know in the comments below
because you guys like that idea I would happily make more for future videos of
course if you like this video give it a thumbs up if you haven't already hit
subscribe leave a comment and if you make any of these for yourself please
post some pictures and either send them to me or post them on the DM Scottie
Facebook page I'm on there all the time a little too much and if you can link
back to black magic crafts that would be awesome okay
I'll see you guys again in episode 7
